column5: Heads up: http://inspection.gc.ca/about-the-cfia/newsroom/food-recall-warnings/complete-listing/2017-09-01/eng/1504321873804/1504321877058    I don't use it but thanks for the heads up!
Got freaked out for a second but nope, I bought fish crisp.

I don't use it but thanks for the heads up!   Got freaked out for a second but nope, I bought fish crisp.  Same here. I hadn't heard of it before either but figured that this might be a place that someone would have.
I've used it but years ago. Def. Found better coatings.  Thanks for the heads up though! Im sure numerous anglers on this board still use that product
I like the store bought coatings, but prefer: crushed cornflakes, panko, regular bread crumbs  or Italian seasoned bread crumbs. I use the same for grouse as well.
never understood buying coating when cornmeal, flour and some s&p is all you need  Quetico pickerel tasted good in that, mmm.

Nothing wrong with that at all. Heck just flour/seasoning salt is great!  But I rotate because there are ALOT of ways to enjoy fish  Sa.e reason I'll cook/season eggs about 20 different ways, and enjoy them all!

Nothing wrong with that at all. Heck just flour/seasoning salt is great!  But I rotate because there are ALOT of ways to enjoy fish  Sa.e reason I'll cook/season eggs about 20 different ways, and enjoy them all!   yup. but you forgot to mention bacon and only one way for that, cheeewwwy !
On the BBQ is my fav way
